intro: Rhynchospora polystachys, commonly known as the many-stemmed spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of eastern North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces dense clusters of small, reddish-brown flowers arranged in spike-like inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. Rhynchospora polystachys thrives in moist to wet soil conditions, often found in marshes, swales, and along the edges of ponds. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
